Package invariant

Class InvariantStatement

  • java.lang.Object
    • invariant.InvariantStatement

  • public class InvariantStatement
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for generating invariant "statements" like the ones used in CIF.
    Author:
    Bharat Garhewal

    • Method Detail

      • InvariantStatementUnusedBuild

        public static java.lang.String InvariantStatementUnusedBuild​(java.lang.String actionName,
                                                             java.lang.Integer posAction,
                                                             java.lang.String subSpecName)
        Generate "unused" action invariant. That is, generates an invariant that blocks an action "actionName" from occurring at state "posAction". We need the name of the sub-specification in order to specify the position, as our states are called "s1" or "s2" or so on for all our sub-specifications. Note: Values of states are incremented by one in order to account for CIF3's insistence of starting from "s1" when minimizing automata.
        Parameters:
        actionName -
        posAction -
        subSpecName -
        Returns:

      • buildInvariantStatement

        public java.lang.String buildInvariantStatement​()
        Construct the invariant statement associated with the values stored in the object. Note: Values of states are incremented by one in order to account for CIF3's insistence of starting from "s1" when minimizing automata.
